commit_message:
Allow Events without traits to be returned

Due to the join with Traits done in the SqlAlchemy implementation
of get_events, only Events with Traits can be returned from that
call. This would be expected behavior if Traits are provided in
the filter, but if no Traits are provided, all matching Events
should be returned. Even those without Traits.

The solution to this is to pre-populate the dictionary of Event
models before populating their Traits in the case of no Trait
filters being provided.

The table compute_node_stats is used to save additional statistics information
of compute nodes. However, nova schedulers need to call compute_node_get_all()
to get node information, which causes performance drop by join when the number
of the nodes is huge.

subject: Add DiskReader class to diskfile
commit_message:
Add DiskReader class to diskfile

Move all .metadata access under DiskFile "open" in object-server

Raise DiskFileSizeInvalid when Content-Length does not match size

When get_obj_size raises a DiskFileSizeInvalid error it will automatically
quarantine the object.  This makes the quarantine method on the DiskReader
effectively private except when it's used explicitly by the auditor for
generic handling of unexpected DiskFileErrors.

Any attempt to iterate over an instance of DiskReader will ensure that the
obj_size has been validated against the Content-Length in the metadata.  The
object-server already did this, and it is now enforced in tests as well.

When closing a DiskReader, if the _obj_size has been set (either by an
explicit call to get_obj_size, or by iterating over the body) the close method
will always automatically attempt to verify and possibly quarantine the file.
Since a Content-Length mis-match would have been caught before iterating the
file this always automatic close verification will only effect the ETag
validation which is only performed when the entire body of the DiskReader is
consumed.  Setting a "verify_close" attribute on the reader instance will have
no effect.

Consolidate quarnatine call sites on DiskReader

Add keep_cache_size to DiskReader constructor so that the DiskReader class may
optionally keep smaller files in the page cache.
Remove keep_data_fp argument from DiskFile constructor

All access to the data_file fp for DiskFile is moved under the new "open"
method.  This reduces the surface area of the DiskFile abstraction and reduces
the exposure of the underlying implementation in the object-server.

Move all DiskFile artifact manipulation under DiskWriter

All write access to the underlying DiskFile artifacts has been moved to
DiskWriter.  DiskWriter will create .data, .meta, and .ts files as well as
delete them.  The public "unlinkold" DiskFile method has been moved to
DiskWriter and manages it's calling.

Expose public helper method "update_metadata" to replace put_metadata, and
re-factor "delete" to use DiskWriter directly and more efficiently.

New public "delete" method on DiskFile

commit_message:
Add block device handling to build_and_run_instance

If we have block device mappings we want to prep them and pass them to
the virt driver spawn method so they can be attached to the instance.
If there's a failure during the instance creation the volumes will get
cleaned up.

A failure to prep the block devices will abort a build because it can't
be built as desired and the failure is not likely to be related to the
compute node itself.

On an instance build failure we make an attempt to clean up the block
devices for the instance.  If that fails we are left in a bad state and
will not attempt to reschedule the instance.

This is one part of a series of patches to build up the
build_and_run_instance method.

subject: Clean up logical volume on resize/migrate
commit_message:
Clean up logical volume on resize/migrate

When resize/migrate VM, the logical volume on source host was not
deleted, this will cause some garbage logical volume on source host
if resize/migrate to different host.

In addition, if an instance is resized/migrated to a hypervisor with
a previous old logical volume (with that same instance disk ID) it
will simply re-use the existing volume and not upgrade/downgrade the
image size.

The fix was destroy the old logical volume when resize instance,
thus when resize finished, nova compute will try to re-create the
logical volume image again based on new flavor.

getxattr("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", "user.some.key", "some-value", 10) = 10
